intro: Euphrasia petiolaris var. petiolaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, and it produces a delicate, glandular-hairy foliage. The species is often found in moist meadows and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
